annotations: Intel Corp. said it reached an agreement with Alliant Computer Systems Corp. to develop software standards for Intel 's i860 microprocessor .
The i860 , introduced earlier this year , is Intel 's entry in the crowded market for reduced instruction set computing , or RISC , computers .
Intel , based in Santa Clara , Calif. , is the market leader for traditional microprocessors with its 8086 family that forms the heart of IBM - compatible personal computers .
Under the agreement , Intel will invest $ 3 million to acquire a 4 % stake in Alliant , a maker of minisupercomputers for scientists and engineers .

Alliant , based in Littleton , Mass. , will license its parallel - computing technologies to Intel , providing users a way to let many i860 microprocessors in a single computer work on a problem simultaneously .
Alliant said it plans to use the microprocessor in future products .
It declined to discuss its plans for upgrading its current product line .
